Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

OOC:  That computer is the hub, the core processing computer.  There are a few other computers which are operational, but require the hub in order to grant full access.  Navagation, Library and Logs, Sensors, Engines, Internal systems, and Communications all connect to the Core Prossessing computer.  Fix the CPC, and you will restore all the computer systems.
 
Hellplague:
 
"How do you know how to build componants and repair that computer?  It's amazing work.  I have never seen someone pretty much build a computer from sratch.  How do you do it?" the femme asked as Celeron worked on the damaged computer.
SHe sat in a corner and reclined back, finding it interesting to watch the bot work.

Alex Sell <kraftlos@...> wrote:
After about an hour Celeron finished rewiring the power supply using
parts from the fried one and scraps of wiring that for some reason
were lieing around.  He then threw the broken pieces into an area that
he would designate as his junk pile.  After a quick examination, he
realized that the computer could be turned on (though it would not be
able to be used yet as he hadn't build any networking parts or
replaced the other 2 interface cards).  But he was pleasently suprised
to find that all the software was still intact).  He turned if off,
then when out into the ship again looking for more parts.

OOC: Is this computer the ship's main computer?
